outcome: /JUDGMENT IN CC 2734/2015 OF JUDICIAL MAGISTRATE OF FIRST CLASS, THALASSERY PETITIONER/ACCUSED NO.1: SARITHA.S. NAIR AGED 45 YEARS D/O INDIRA DEVI, VATTAPARAPADINJARAEATHIL, EAST OF YMCA, CHENGANNUR,
full_text: ahal ic 2024/KER/2897 IN THE HIGH COURT OF KERALA AT ERNAKULAM PRESENT THE HONOURABLE MR. JUSTICE BECHU KURIAN THOMAS THURSDAY, THE 11 DAY OF JANUARY 2024 / 21ST POUSHA, 1945 CRL.MC NO. 241 OF 2024 CRIME NO.1647/2012 OF THALASSERY EXCISE RANGE OFFICE, KANNUR AGAINST THE ORDER/JUDGMENT IN CC 2734/2015 OF JUDICIAL MAGISTRATE OF FIRST CLASS, THALASSERY PETITIONER/ACCUSED NO.1: SARITHA.S. NAIR AGED 45 YEARS D/O INDIRA DEVI, VATTAPARAPADINJARAEATHIL, EAST OF YMCA, CHENGANNUR, ALAPPUZHA, PIN - 689121 BY ADV M.R.SARIN RESPONDENT: STATE OF KERALA REPRESENTED BY THE PUBLIC PROSECUTOR, HIGH COURT OF KERALA, ERNAKULAM, PIN - 682031 OTHER PRESENT: SMT. V. SREEJA (PP) THIS CRIMINAL MISC. CASE HAVING COME UP FOR ADMISSION ON 11.01.2024, THE COURT ON THE SAME DAY PASSED THE FOLLOWING: mo) CRL.MC NO. 241 OF 2024 ELIZ BECHU KURIAN THOMAS, J. ~ Cri.M.C. No. 241 of 2024 Dated this the 11" day of January, 2024 ORDER Petitioner is the 1* accused in C.C No.2734 of 2015 on the files of the Judicial First Class Magistrate Court, Thalassery, facing prosecution for the offences under Sections 406, 419, 420, 468, 471 and 120B of the Indian Penal Code, 1860. 2. Petitioner contends that, on 20.01.2023, due to the failure of the petitioner to appear before the court, a non bailable warrant has been issued, after canceling the bail. The petitioner seeks for a direction to consider his applications for recall of warrant and grant of bail on the day of appearance itself. 3. Sri. Sarin, learned counsel for the petitioner contends that, petitioner is suffering from various health issues and that, she is undergoing medical treatment and hence, failure on 20.01.2023 was not willful. 4. | heard Smt. Sreeja V., learned Public Prosecutor as well. ail i . ee] pat 2024/KER/2897 CRL.MC NO. 241 OF 2024 5. Since a non bailable warrant has been issued against the petitioner for her failure to appear on 20.01.2023 and she has undertaken to appear before the court within the next 15 days. | am of the view that, a liberal approach can be adopted and the application, if any filed by her can be directed to be considered on the same day itself. 6. Accordingly, there will be a direction to the the Judicial First Class Magistrate Court, Thalassery to consider the application, if any filed by the petitioner for recall of warrant and for bail on the same day of her appearance itself provided such applications are filed within 15 days from today. The non bailable warrant issued against the petitioner will be kept in abeyance for a period of 15 days from today, to enable the petitioner to comply with the above directions. The Criminal Miscellaneous Case is disposed of. NAIR ADDITIONAL PROFESSOR SREE CHITHIRA THIRUNNAL INSTITUTE OF MEDICAL SCIENCE AND TECHNOLOGY TRIVANDRUM DATED 8 .01.2024 // True Copy // PA To Judge
